body:
Let's take a look at https://docs.perl6.org/js/search.js , we generate it through https://github.com/perl6/doc/blob/master/htmlify.p6 https://github.com/perl6/doc/blob/master/template/search_template.js

now we see some `X<>` tag parsing beyond contributors' expectation, make duplicate entries or invalid entry. Besides, `category: "Reference"` occurs unexpectedly and url form like `url: " /language/regexes#index-entry-regex__%3C%7Cw%3E-regex__%3C%21%7Cw%3E-%3C%7Cw%3E_and_%3C%21%7Cw%3E%2C_word_boundary"` make `L<>` refer ugly as well as incomprehensible

since htmlify.p6 was given to birth so long ago, I cannot understand a number of its design and logic, so can anybody please explain/talk about  how search logic in htmlify.p6 works? Maybe about `write-search-file()` and subroutines it calls.

Co #1823
title: How does search logic in htmlify.p6 works?
